title: Previous Research
text:
In my research with Dr. Fields, I explored the effect of SCD on the structural and functional connectivity of the brain in pediatric patients receiving care at St. Louis Children’s Hospital. Some of the notable findings from my research with the Fields lab were that we observed an acute reversal in cognitive deficits and decreased functional connectivity in the fronto-parietal network after a single RBC transfusion. I also explored other MR biomarkers of cerebral metabolic stress, including oxygen extraction fraction (OEF) and its relationship to structural and functional connectivity in children with SCD. Some of the projects that I worked on while with the Fields lab were:



GRAPES: Trivia game increases sickle cell disease knowledge in patients and providers and mitigates healthcare biases
Reversibility of Cognitive Deficits and Functional Connectivity with Transfusion in Children with SCD
Cognitive Outcomes of Children and Adults with SCA

title: Current Projects
text: Dr. Lilyana Angelov has welcomed me into her research group at the Rosa Ella Burkhart Brain Tumor & Neuro-Oncology Center in the Department of Neurosurgery at Cleveland Clinic. In her research, Dr. Angelov investigates the effectiveness of different SRS techniques to treat brain and spine tumor metastases. As I become a part of her lab, we are in the process of defining a project that I will lead. Updates on these research efforts are forthcoming.

title: Current Projects
text: Dr. Lilyana Angelov has welcomed me into her research group at the Rosa Ella Burkhart Brain Tumor & Neuro-Oncology Center in the Department of Neurosurgery at Cleveland Clinic. In her research, Dr. Angelov investigates the effectiveness of different SRS techniques to treat brain and spine tumor metastases. As I become a part of her lab, we are in the process of defining a project that I will lead. Updates on these research efforts are forthcoming.

title: Current Projects
section: Enhanced Recovery After Surgery (ERAS) Protocol for Tether Cord Syndrome (TCS)
text:
Enhanced Recovery After Surgery (ERAS) Protocol for Tether Cord Syndrome (TCS)

Since I have started at CWRU SOM, I have become involved with Dr. Krystal Tomei’s research group at University Hospitals Rainbow Babies and Childrens Hospital. The current project I am working on is determining the efficacy of utilizing an enhanced recovery after surgery (ERAS) protocol in pediatric patients who have undergone detethering surgery to correct TCS. The secondary objective of this study is to see whether implementing a standardized ERAS protocol for patients who undergo detethering helps to mitigate post-operative opiate consumption.

title: CHANGE TITLE AFTER ANALYSIS!
text:
library(janitor)
library(knitr)
library(magrittr)
library(broom)
library(naniar)
library(patchwork)
library(modelsummary)
library(pwr)
library(haven) # Package to ingest SAS transport files for 2017-2020 Pre-pandemic NHANES data
library(tidyverse)

source("data/Love-boost.R")

theme_set(theme_light())  # or use theme_set(theme_bw())
knitr::opts_chunk$set(comment=NA)




I ingested the demographic raw data from the NHANES 2017-2020 Pre-Pandemic Demographic data.

# Initially save the data from the NHANES Pre-pandemic 2017-2020 SAS transport
#demographic <- haven::read_xpt("data/P_DEMO.xpt")

#saveRDS(demographic, "data/P_DEMO.Rds")

# Simply read the tibble after data are saved
demographic <- readRDS("data/P_DEMO.Rds")

I ingested the standard biochemistry panel raw data from the NHANES 2017-2020 Pre-Pandemic Laboratory data.

# Initially save the data from the NHANES Pre-pandemic 2017-2020 SAS transport
#biochem <- haven::read_xpt("data/P_BIOPRO.xpt")

#saveRDS(biochem, "data/P_BIOPRO.Rds")

# Simply read the tibble after data are saved
biochem <- readRDS("data/P_BIOPRO.Rds")

Finally, I ingested the Alcohol Use raw data from the NHANES 2017-2020 Pre-Pandemic Questionnaire data.

# Initially save the data from the NHANES Pre-pandemic 2017-2020 SAS transport
#alcohol <- haven::read_xpt("data/P_ALQ.xpt")

#saveRDS(alcohol, "data/P_ALQ.Rds")

# Simply read the tibble after data are saved
alcohol <- readRDS("data/P_ALQ.Rds")

title: Welcome to my website!
text:
ResearchGate
  
  
    
     GoogleScholar
  
  
    
     Twitter
  
  
    
     Github
  
  
    
     LinkedIn
  
  
    
     Email
  




Welcome to my website!
I am Landon Power, a medical student and researcher at Case Western Reserve University School of Medicine. I am in Dr. Lilyana Angelov’s research group at the Cleveland Clinic Brain Tumor and Neuro-Oncology Center.
My hometown is Hastings, Nebraska, a small city in the mid-western part of the state. I completed my undergraduate education at Washington University in St. Louis. While in St. Louis, I worked as a student researcher at St. Louis Children’s Hospital in hematology/oncology. In Dr. Melanie Fields’s lab, I did research on the cognitive impacts of sickle cell disease (SCD) and used MRI to quantify the structural and functional affect of SCD on the brain.
Currently, my research interests are focused in stereotactic radiosurgery (SRS/gamma knife surgery). I have recently joined the Angelov lab and am in the process of defining my own project to explore surgical outcomes of SRS for brain and spine tumors.
As a medical student, I am involved in student leadership through the Student Committee on Medical Education (SCME). I am the student representative for Block 6: Cognition, Sensation, and Movement, which covers Neurology and the Behavioral Sciences. In this role, I convey student feedback to administrators and act as the student representative on the curricular design team for Block 6.
On my website, you can find my published scholarly articles and papers as well as descriptions of the current projects I am working on in research. Please feel free to contact me if you have questions or thoughts.
